required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The primary goal of this project is to investigate the potential efficacy of exogenous progesterone (with supplemental relapse prevention counseling) on postpartum relapse in new mothers. Also to determine the feasibility of enhanced compliance monitoring and identification of collateral factors effecting outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: Pregnant women will be recruited at gestational weeks 33-36 who have quit smoking during pregnancy and are motivated to maintain abstinence after delivery. At the time of delivery, women will be randomly assigned to receive 4 weeks of active or placebo exogenous progesterone starting on the 4th day postpartum. Participants will be in contact with study staff either by phone or clinic visits until 12 weeks postpartum to collect data on smoking status and protocol compliance, measure serum progesterone levels and receive behavioral counseling.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Relapsed by Week 4 Postpartum
primary_outcome.description: Determined by seven-day point prevalence, a binary smoking relapse outcome - defined as a single puff of a cigarette during the seven days prior to a pre-specified time point of interest.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Relapsed by Week 12 Postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Determined by seven-day point prevalence, a binary smoking relapse outcome - defined as a single puff of a cigarette during the seven days prior to a pre-specified time point of interest.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Relapsed at All During Postpartum (up to Day 84)
secondary_outcome.description: Defined by continuous abstinence (CA) defined as a single puff of a cigarette as a relapse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Protocol Compliance - Number of Visits Attended
secondary_outcome.description: Compliance was measured as the number of visits attended (maximum of 5).

This was determined by the Feasibility Questionnaire; a 10-item measure used to assess participant expectations, satisfaction of study protocol, study medication and electronic data capture. All questions were answered on a four-point Likert-type scale (1=low acceptability and 4=high acceptability). The total score was determined by adding up all the scores and dividing by 10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Protocol Compliance - Doses of Medication Taken
secondary_outcome.description: Compliance was measured by doses of medication taken (maximum of 56).
Compliance was measured as the number by number of EDCs completed (maximum of 84).

arm_group.description: Take micronized natural progesterone capsule by mouth, twice daily (approximately at 8 am and 8 pm) for four weeks beginning on postpartum day 4.
Take placebo capsule by mouth, twice daily (approximately at 8 am and 8 pm) for 4 weeks beginning on postpartum day 4.

intervention.description: Take micronized natural progesterone capsule by mouth, twice daily (approximately at 8 am and 8 pm) for four weeks beginning on postpartum day 4.
Take placebo capsule by mouth, twice daily (approximately at 8 am and 8 pm) for 4 weeks beginning on postpartum day 4.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Woman
- 18-35 years old
- Zero CPD for past 4 weeks
- 5 or more CPD for at least 6 out of past 12 months
- Motivated to remain abstinent (7 or higher out of 10)
- Stable physical/mental health
- Established prenatal care
- Stable physical/mental health
- Willing to take Progesterone
- Willing to use double-barrier protection if sexually active
- English fluency
- Able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Psychotropic medications
- Illicit drugs
- Other types of tobacco, NRT, smoking cessation medications
- Pregnancy complications (Diabetes, Anomaly, Fetal growth restriction, HTN, Hx of >2 miscarriages)
- Current use of: Finasteroid (propecia), Efavirenz, Red Clover, Ketoconazole, CYP3A4 Inhibitors
- History of: Thrombophelitis, Deep vein thrombosis, Pulmonary embolus, Clotting disorder, Bleeding disorder, Heart disease, Diabetes, Stroke, Peanut allergy, Liver dysfunction, Hypersensitivity to progesterone

overall_official.affiliation: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota

facility.name: University of Minnesota, 717 Delaware Street SE

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
